item.title: 税务人员喜欢 Z 世代追逐的 90% 的收益率
item.description:
这里有更多关于我们所处的 "创新杠铃 "的信息

。【原文：

Here’s more about the “innovation barbell” we’re in

】

item.title: Switch 2 打破销售记录，巩固任天堂全球领先地位
item.description:
对乐趣的传统关注和对技术潮流的抵制造就了一家与众不同的视频游戏制造商。【原文：

Un enfoque tradicional centrado en la diversión y la resistencia a las tendencias tecnológicas han dado lugar a un creador de videojuegos diferente a cualquier otro.

】

item.title: PredictIt 获美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）批准推出受监管交易所
item.description: 周五公布的文件显示，PredictIt 公司已获准扩大业务，成为一家受监管的衍生品交易所。【原文：PredictIt, a popular but previously unlicensed exchange for political junkies to put money on election outcomes, has won approval to expand operations as a regulated derivatives exchange, according to documents released Friday.】

item.title: 欧佩克+产量信号刺激期权赌注 石油将跌破 60 美元
item.description: 最近几天，大量关于布伦特原油今年将跌破每桶60美元的押注易手，这表明投资者正在对冲欧佩克及其盟国再次大幅增产的风险。【原文：A flurry of bets on Brent crude falling below $60 a barrel this year changed hands in recent days, a sign investors are hedging against the risk of another large production hike from OPEC and its allies.】

item.title: Anthropic 将支付 15 亿美元解决作者版权索赔问题
item.description: Anthropic PBC 将支付 15 亿美元，以解决作者对人工智能公司下载数百万本盗版书的版权诉讼，这是迄今为止人工智能和知识产权领域最大的和解案之一。【原文：Anthropic PBC will pay $1.5 billion to resolve an authors’ copyright lawsuit over the AI company’s downloading of millions of pirated books, one of the largest settlements over artificial intelligence and intellectual property to date.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会成立外国公司证券欺诈问题特别工作组
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会正在成立一个新部门，重点打击外国公司的证券欺诈行为，这是该监管机构在特朗普政府执政期间执法重点的最初信号之一。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission is setting up a new unit to focus on securities fraud by foreign companies, one of the first signals of the regulator’s enforcement priorities under the Trump administration.】

item.title: 斯塔默希望在雷纳留下的残骸上重建英超联赛
item.description: 失去一位高级副手势必会让基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）的政府陷入危机。英国首相尽其所能，化险为夷，挽救了自己的首相职位。【原文：The loss of a top deputy was bound to plunge Keir Starmer’s government into crisis. The British prime minister did what he could to turn a bad day into a chance to save his premiership.】

item.title: 糟糕的就业报告公布后，贷款人反驳加拿大银行的削减要求
item.description: 在一份不如预期的就业报告公布后，加拿大最大的两家贷款机构认为加拿大央行将在本月晚些时候下调借贷成本。【原文：Two of Canada’s largest lenders now see the Bank of Canada cutting borrowing costs later this month after a worse-than-expected jobs report.】

item.title: 巴西监管机构最终批准 Marfrig-BRF 交易
item.description: 巴西反垄断监管机构最终批准了牛肉供应商 Marfrig Global Foods SA 以 26 亿美元收购鸡肉生产商 BRF SA 的交易，为创建全球最大的肉类公司之一铺平了道路。【原文：Brazil’s antitrust regulator gave final approval to beef supplier Marfrig Global Foods SA’s $2.6 billion takeover of chicken producer BRF SA, paving the way for the creation of one of the world’s largest meat companies.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比希望在决定利率前获得通胀数据
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，他仍未决定将在央行 9 月 16-17 日的会议上支持采取何种行动，并指出下周将公布通胀数据。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said he’s still undecided on what course of action he will support at the central bank’s Sept. 16-17 meeting, pointing to inflation data due next week.】

item.title: 小肯尼迪与自闭症有关的报道导致 Kenvue 下挫
item.description: 在《华尔街日报》报道卫生部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr.）可能将该公司的泰诺止痛药与自闭症联系起来后，Kenvue 公司的股价下跌。【原文：Kenvue Inc.’s shares fell after the Wall Street Journal reported that Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is likely to link the company’s Tylenol painkiller to autism.】

item.title: Lululemon 难以实现的复苏引发分析师一天内七次下调评级
item.description: Lululemon Athletica Inc.在一天之内遭到至少七位分析师下调评级，分析师称这家高档服装零售商需要 "战略支点"。【原文：Lululemon Athletica Inc. was hit with at least seven analyst downgrades in a single day as analysts say the upscale clothing retailer needs a “strategic pivot.”】

item.title: 就业数据锁定降息押注，债券反弹，债券市场债券上涨
item.description: 在就业增长逊于预期的情况下，市场对美联储将在今年降低利率以刺激经济的预期升温，市政债券随之反弹。【原文：Municipal bonds rallied after weaker-than-expected job growth raised expectations that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates this year to help stoke the economy.】

item.title: 重制《最终幻想战术》比想象中难得多
item.description:
Square Enix 的工程师们在多年的开发过程中，费尽心力地重新创建了原版游戏的代码

。【原文：

Engineers at Square Enix had to laboriously recreate the original game’s code over years of development

】

item.title: 高通公司首席执行官称英特尔的芯片产量还不够好
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm Inc.首席执行官克里斯蒂安诺-阿蒙（Cristiano Amon）说，英特尔公司的生产技术目前还不够完善，不足以成为这家手机处理器制造商的供应商。【原文：Qualcomm Inc. Chief Executive Officer Cristiano Amon said Intel Corp.’s production technology isn’t currently good enough for the maker of mobile phone processors to use as a supplier.】

item.title: 中国深圳加入主要城市放宽购房规定的行列
item.description: 中国的科技中心深圳紧随其他大城市放宽购房规定，这是亚洲最大经济体当局为遏制长期房地产危机所做的最新尝试。【原文：China’s tech hub of Shenzhen followed other large cities in easing home-buying rules in the latest attempt by authorities in Asia’s biggest economy to contain a prolonged property crisis.】

item.title: 嘉吉公司因可可豆质量问题停止在象牙海岸加工可可
item.description: 据知情人士透露，嘉吉公司已经停止了在象牙海岸的可可研磨工作，因为质量差、废料含量高的可可豆抑制了产量，并有损坏机器的风险。【原文：Cargill Inc. has halted cocoa grinding in Ivory Coast as poor-quality beans with unusually high levels of waste material curb yields and risk damaging machinery, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 玉米创 7 月以来新高，美国出口在 WASDE 之前保持强劲
item.description: 周五，大多数农作物价格上涨，其中玉米价格升至7月份以来的最高水平，原因是对黄色谷物的出口需求强劲。【原文：Most crop prices gained Friday, with corn rising to the highest level since July amid robust export demand for the yellow grain.】

item.title: 贝森特敦促美联储进行独立审查，批评过度刺激政策
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）抨击美联储通过 "任务蠕变 "将自身的独立性置于风险之中，并呼吁对美国中央银行进行独立审查，包括其货币政策。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent blasted the Federal Reserve for putting its own independence at risk through “mission creep” and called for an independent review of the US central bank, including its monetary policy.】

item.title: 据说 Loveholidays 的所有者将为伦敦首次公开募股选择银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 Livingbridge 已选择银行安排在线旅行社 Loveholidays 在伦敦的潜在上市事宜，这为英国资本市场增添了动力。【原文：Private equity firm Livingbridge has selected banks to arrange a potential listing of online travel agent Loveholidays in London, according to people familiar with the matter, adding momentum to the UK’s capital markets.】

item.title: 意大利总统塔亚尼 "绝对 "反对对企业回购征税
item.description: 意大利副总理安东尼奥-塔亚尼（Antonio Tajani）公开反对对企业股票回购征税的潜在计划，这进一步扩大了他公开反对提高税收的记录。【原文：Italian Deputy Prime Minister Antonio Tajani spoke out against a potential plan to tax corporate stock buybacks, adding to his track record of vocal opposition to higher taxes.】

item.title: 政治瘫痪使法国成为市场的焦点
item.description:
法国政府试图解决财政赤字膨胀问题的努力遭到拒绝，法国政府很可能在周一垮台。【原文：

The French government is likely to collapse on Monday after its attempts to deal with a ballooning fiscal deficit were rejected.

】

item.title: 卢特尼克抨击瑞士制药巨头赚美国的钱
item.description: 商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）把目光投向了瑞士的旗舰制药业，他说，瑞士之所以 "如此富有"，是因为它向美国出口了大量药品。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick zeroed in on Switzerland’s flagship pharmaceutical industry, saying that the country is “so rich” because of its vast exports of drugs to the US.】

item.title: 英伟达因博通与开放人工智能（OpenAI）的协议而下滑，威胁到 4 万亿美元的价值
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）股价周五下跌，这家芯片制造商近两个月来首次面临失去 4 万亿美元历史估值的风险。【原文：Nvidia Corp. shares fell on Friday, with the chipmaker at risk of losing its historic $4 trillion valuation for the first time in nearly two months.】

item.title: 电动汽车充电器 SparkCharge 计划向欧洲和中东扩张
item.description: SparkCharge 首席执行官约书亚-阿维夫（Joshua Aviv）表示，SparkCharge 计划将其移动电动汽车充电服务扩展到欧洲和中东地区。【原文：SparkCharge is planning to expand its mobile electric-vehicle charging services to Europe and the Middle East, according to Chief Executive Officer Joshua Aviv.】

item.title: 库珀将出任英国外交大臣，拉米出任副总理
item.description: 继二把手安吉拉-雷纳（Angela Rayner）辞职后，基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）于周五下午对英国内阁进行了改组，更换了多名高级部长，以重新启动其摇摇欲坠的一年之久的政府。【原文：Keir Starmer reshuffled the UK Cabinet on Friday afternoon following the resignation of his No. 2, Angela Rayner, swapping a number of senior ministers in a bid to relaunch his faltering year-old government.】

item.title: 据说 EDF 考虑将意大利米兰爱迪生公司重新上市
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）正在考虑将其意大利子公司 Edison SpA 在米兰重新上市。【原文：Electricite de France SA is weighing a relisting of its Italian unit Edison SpA in Milan, as the French utility faces mounting capital expenditure on its nuclear projects in its home country, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 就业数据预示美联储将缩减开支，美元将迎来第五周下跌
item.description: 美国劳动力市场报告显示出人意料的疲软，促使交易商锁定美联储本月降息，美元延续了2023年4月以来的最长连跌走势。【原文：The dollar extended its longest losing streak since April 2023 after a report on the US labor market showed surprising weakness, prompting traders to lock in an interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 谷歌因滥用广告技术权力被欧盟罚款近 30 亿欧元
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司被欧盟罚款近 30 亿欧元（35 亿美元），并被勒令停止偏袒自己的广告技术服务，此举有可能进一步激化与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的紧张关系。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google was fined almost €3 billion ($3.5 billion) by the European Union and ordered to stop favoring its own advertising technology services, in a move that risks further inflaming tensions with US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 就业市场报告疲软，美联储降息预期升温
item.description: 周五公布的就业数据令人失望，验证了人们对美国劳动力市场可能处于下滑边缘的担忧，并提升了人们对美联储今年降息幅度的预期。【原文：Disappointing employment data released Friday validated fears that the US labor market may be on the brink of a downturn and lifted expectations for how much the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates this year.】
